Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the clarity of Flathead Lake by stating it is "remarkably clear."
Understate: The claim may understate the depth of Flathead Lake by not mentioning its actual depth of 370 feet.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the clarity of Flathead Lake.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph accurately represents the clarity of the entire lake, which may not be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by mentioning that the photograph was taken close to shore where the lake is shallower, suggesting that the clarity seen in the picture may not extend to the deepest points of the lake.
